vaccines_given.description: The Bacille Calmette-Gu√©rin (BCG) vaccine is administered to protect against tuberculosis (TB).
vaccines_given.side_effects_given: Common side effects when BCG vaccine is given may include redness, swelling, or a small sore at the injection site. Rarely, more serious side effects can occur.
vaccines_given.side_effects_not_given: Without the BCG vaccine, the child is at higher risk of developing tuberculosis (TB) and its complications, which can be life-threatening.

vaccines_given.description: The Oral Polio Vaccine (OPV) 0 is given orally to provide protection against polio.
vaccines_given.side_effects_given: Common side effects of OPV may include mild fever or gastrointestinal symptoms. Serious side effects are rare.
vaccines_given.side_effects_not_given: Without OPV, the child is at risk of contracting polio, a highly infectious disease that can lead to paralysis.

vaccines_given.description: The Hepatitis B vaccine is administered by injection on the left thigh under the skin. It offers protection against Hepatitis B.
vaccines_given.administration: Injected on left thigh under the skin
vaccines_given.side_effects_given: Common side effects of the Hepatitis B vaccine may include pain or swelling at the injection site. Serious side effects are rare.
vaccines_given.side_effects_not_given: Without the Hepatitis B vaccine, the child is at risk of contracting Hepatitis B, a viral infection that can lead to liver disease.

vaccines_given.description: The Oral Polio Vaccine (OPV) 1 is given orally to protect against polio.
vaccines_given.side_effects_given: Common side effects of OPV may include mild fever or gastrointestinal symptoms. Serious side effects are rare.
vaccines_given.side_effects_not_given: Without OPV, the child is at risk of contracting polio, a highly infectious disease that can lead to paralysis.

vaccines_given.description: The Rotavirus-1 vaccine is administered orally to guard against Rotavirus infection.
vaccines_given.side_effects_given: Common side effects of the Rotavirus vaccine may include mild diarrhea or vomiting. Serious side effects are rare.
vaccines_given.side_effects_not_given: Without the Rotavirus vaccine, the child is at risk of severe diarrhea and dehydration caused by Rotavirus infection.

vaccines_given.description: The Pneumococcal-1 vaccine is injected in the left thigh to protect against certain bacterial infections, such as pneumonia and meningitis.
vaccines_given.side_effects_given: Common side effects of the Pneumococcal vaccine may include pain or redness at the injection site. Serious side effects are rare.
vaccines_given.side_effects_not_given: Without the Pneumococcal vaccine, the child is at risk of severe bacterial infections like pneumonia and meningitis.

vaccines_given.description: The Pentavalent-1 vaccine is administered via injection in the right thigh. It provides protection against five potential killers: Diphtheria, Tetanus, Pertussis, Hib, and Hepatitis B.
vaccines_given.side_effects_given: Common side effects of the Pentavalent vaccine may include pain or swelling at the injection site. Serious side effects are rare.
vaccines_given.side_effects_not_given: Without the Pentavalent vaccine, the child is at risk of multiple potentially life-threatening diseases.

vaccines_given.description: The Oral Polio Vaccine (OPV) 2 is administered orally to safeguard against polio.
vaccines_given.side_effects_given: Common side effects of OPV may include mild fever or gastrointestinal symptoms. Serious side effects are rare.
vaccines_given.side_effects_not_given: Without OPV, the child is at risk of contracting polio, a highly infectious disease that can lead to paralysis.

vaccines_given.description: The Rotavirus-2 vaccine is given orally to provide immunity against Rotavirus infection.
vaccines_given.side_effects_given: Common side effects of the Rotavirus vaccine may include mild diarrhea or vomiting. Serious side effects are rare.
vaccines_given.side_effects_not_given: Without the Rotavirus vaccine, the child is at risk of severe diarrhea and dehydration caused by Rotavirus infection.

vaccines_given.side_effects_not_given: Without the Pneumococcal vaccine, the child is at risk of severe bacterial infections like pneumonia and meningitis.

vaccines_given.side_effects_given: Common side effects of the Pentavalent vaccine may include pain or swelling at the injection site. Serious side effects are rare.
vaccines_given.side_effects_not_given: Without the Pentavalent vaccine, the child is at risk of multiple potentially life-threatening diseases.

vaccines_given.description: The Oral Polio Vaccine (OPV) 3 is given orally to ensure protection against polio.
vaccines_given.side_effects_given: Common side effects of OPV may include mild fever or gastrointestinal symptoms. Serious side effects are rare.
vaccines_given.side_effects_not_given: Without OPV, the child is at risk of contracting polio, a highly infectious disease that can lead to paralysis.

vaccines_given.description: The IPV (Inactivated Poliovirus Vaccine) is injected in the left thigh and protects against severe disease caused by poliovirus.
vaccines_given.side_effects_given: Common side effects of the IPV vaccine may include pain or redness at the injection site. Serious side effects are rare.
vaccines_given.side_effects_not_given: Without the IPV vaccine, the child is at risk of severe poliovirus infection and its complications.

vaccines_given.description: The Pneumococcal-3 vaccine is administered via injection in the left thigh to guard against certain bacterial infections, such as pneumonia and meningitis.
vaccines_given.side_effects_given: Common side effects of the Pneumococcal vaccine may include pain or redness at the injection site. Serious side effects are rare.
vaccines_given.side_effects_not_given: Without the Pneumococcal vaccine, the child is at risk of severe bacterial infections like pneumonia and meningitis.

vaccines_given.description: The Pentavalent-3 vaccine is given via injection in the right thigh. It provides protection against five potential killers: Diphtheria, Tetanus, Pertussis, Hib, and Hepatitis B.
vaccines_given.side_effects_given: Common side effects of the Pentavalent vaccine may include pain or swelling at the injection site. Serious side effects are rare.
vaccines_given.side_effects_not_given: Without the Pentavalent vaccine, the child is at risk of multiple potentially life-threatening diseases.

vaccines_given.description: The Measles-1 vaccine is administered via injection in the left upper arm. It protects against three diseases: Measles, Mumps, and Rubella.
vaccines_given.side_effects_given: Common side effects of the Measles vaccine may include fever, rash, or mild discomfort. Serious side effects are rare.
vaccines_given.side_effects_not_given: Without the Measles vaccine, the child is at risk of contracting Measles, a highly contagious viral infection.

vaccines_given.description: The Measles-2 vaccine is given via injection in the left upper arm. It provides protection against three diseases: Measles, Mumps, and Rubella.
vaccines_given.side_effects_given: Common side effects of the Measles vaccine may include fever, rash, or mild discomfort. Serious side effects are rare.
vaccines_given.side_effects_not_given: Without the Measles vaccine, the child is at risk of contracting Measles, a highly contagious viral infection.
